controller

Class TutorialGameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.TutorialGameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TutorialGameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Creates a tutorial controller that is responsible for running the tutorial in the game that passes information from this class to the game model and tutorial view.
    Author:
    Ryan Barbera, Aaron George, Nick Norton, Thomas Pennington, Grant Zhao

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TutorialGameController(GameController controller)
      Constructor that creates a TutorialGameController object and initializes the game model and game view to setup the tutorial.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Makes a new instance of the tower that is passed into the method and puts it into the tower arrayList.

      Reduces the player money by the cost of the tower that is passed in.

      Goes through each of the tower units and checks to see if the player has enough money to purchase towers when the round is not active.

      Gets the smaller of the two dimensions of the screen size after taking a percentage of the total size.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TutorialGameController

        public TutorialGameController(GameController controller)
        Constructor that creates a TutorialGameController object and initializes the game model and game view to setup the tutorial. Calls modelInit to set information for the player that is playing the game.
        Parameters:
        controller: - the game controller to run methods for the tutorial

    • Method Detail

      • modelInit

        public void modelInit()
        Initializes the player model and will allow the view to update to set this to the different components of the Score Panel and Timer Panel.

      • tutorialButtonClicked

        public void tutorialButtonClicked()
        Called when the tutorial button is clicked from the MainMenu of the game. Gets the player model information and puts this into the view to update the values for game play. Calls checkAfforability to set the game buttons to either enabled or disabled depending on how much SandDollars that the player has in the game.

      • checkAffordability

        public void checkAffordability()
        Goes through each of the tower units and checks to see if the player has enough money to purchase towers when the round is not active. If there is enough money left for the player then the button is enabled, else it is disabled until a player has enough money accumulated up.

      • isAffordable

        public boolean isAffordable(int towerIndex)
        Checks the price of each of the towers buttons that are on the game board. If there is sufficient money left for a player then a true value is returned, else false if a player cannot.
        Parameters:
        towerIndex - the index of each of the towers that are in the game to get its price
        Returns:
        true or false value if the player has enough money to purchase a tower or not

      • startRoundButtonTutorial

        public void startRoundButtonTutorial()
        Called when the start button is clicked on the button panel. Will disable the start button and all tower buttons when the start round button is clicked. Also will start the timer for the current round when this button is clicked.

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        Starts the timer in the game by making a new thread for the game and starts the thread. Terminates any old threads that have been created by making a call to stopTimer().

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Interrupts the current thread that the timer is running on. Will set the current thread to null if a thread is running.

      • addTowerToList

        public void addTowerToList(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e,
                           java.lang.String towerName)
        Makes a new instance of the tower that is passed into the method and puts it into the tower arrayList. Sets the position of the tower to the current mouse position. Subtracts the price of the tower from the player money that is left and updates the view. Checks to make sure that a player has enough money to purchase a tower unit by calling checkAfforability.
        Parameters:
        e - a mouse event that has taken place on the screen
        towerName - a string of a tower that is in the game play

      • addTowerToModel

        public void addTowerToModel(TowerModel tm,
                            Posn posn)
        Reduces the player money by the cost of the tower that is passed in. Adds the tower created to the array list and does not return anything.
        Parameters:
        tm - the towerModel that will be added to the array list
        posn - the position of the mouse on the screen of the towerModel

      • run

        public void run()
        Is the main controller for the game that is run on the thread through the use of the Runnable interface. Keeps track of the time left in the game and is making updates throughout the tutorial. When the round is over a player will be asked if they would like to play again.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • timesUp

        public void timesUp()
        Is called when the time has run out for the round. Resets the timer panel to the original player model time. Goes through each of the towers and enables any towers that the player is able to purchase based on the tower price and player money left from the end of the round.

      • towerButtonIClicked

        public void towerButtonIClicked(int i)
        Sets the information panel with the tower name, tower fact description, tower price, and tower damage based on the button that was clicked on the side panel.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the tower model to get factual information from about estuaries

      • getScreenImageSize

        public int getScreenImageSize()
        Gets the smaller of the two dimensions of the screen size after taking a percentage of the total size. Uses this information for scaling in the game for the size of objects created.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the small of the two sizes of the screen used for resizing the tower labels and components in the game.
